Class that holds the method for the minimization algorithm

  • Constructor Details

    • Minimizer

      public Minimizer()

  • Method Details

    • minimize

      public static Machine minimize(Machine machine)
      Minimizes a given mealy or moore machine. Algorithm works on 3 steps:

      1) Removal of inaccesible states. 2) Removal of redundant states. 3) Reconstruction of the machine.

      Parameters:
      machine - The machine to be minimized
      Returns:
      The minimized machine

    • removeInaccessibleStates

      private static void removeInaccessibleStates(Machine machine)
      Removes the inaccessible states of a machine. Checks for inaccessible states from the start state using the BFS algorithm to traverse the machine
      Parameters:
      machine - The machine being minimized

    • initialPartition

      private static Set<Group> initialPartition(Machine machine)
      Returns the first partition required for the second step in the minimization algorithm. Works by grouping states as follows. Moore: Two states are in the same group if they have the same output Mealy: Two states are in the same group if they have the same output for all transitions
      Parameters:
      machine - machine being minimized
      Returns:
      A set that contains groups, representing the first partition.

    • partitionsAreEqual

      private static boolean partitionsAreEqual(Set<Group> groupsK, Set<Group> groupsKPlusOne)
      Checks if two partitions are equal checking that a group in the first partition is also in the second one.
      Parameters:
      groupsK - The first partition (Pk)
      groupsKPlusOne - The second partition (Pk+1)
      Returns:
      True of both partitions are equal, False if they are different

    • groupIsInPartition

      private static boolean groupIsInPartition(Group group, Set<Group> partition)
      Checks if a group is in a partition. Checks that each state from the group is in at least one group of the same size in the partition being checked;
      Parameters:
      group - Group
      partition - Partition
      Returns:
      True if the group is on the partition. False if th group is not on the partition

    • mergeRedundantStates

      private static Set<Group> mergeRedundantStates(Machine machine)
      Groups equivalent "redundant" states base on the following. Starting from the initial partition P1: Two states are on the same group of P2 if all of their transitions lead to the same groups of P1, for each input symbol.

      Is generalized to Pk and Pk+1 Two states are on the same group of Pk+1 if all of their transitions lead to the same groups of Pk, for each input symbol.

      Parameters:
      machine - machine being minimized
      Returns:
      Partition with the states grouped if they are equivalent

    • reconstructMachine

      static Machine reconstructMachine(Machine machine, Set<Group> partition)
      Creates a new machine, that is equivalent to the machine and is minimal. Rebuilds the machine as follows: 1) Each group in the partition is a new state 2) The group with the start state is the new start state 3) Transitions are taken from the original machine checking only one state in each group. The next states are the groups that contain the original state the transition lead to.
      Parameters:
      machine - Machine being minimized
      partition - Final partition after grouping equal states
      Returns:
      Minimized machine

    • constructNewStateName

      private static String constructNewStateName(Group group)
      Constructs a new State name for the minimized machine, based on a group.
      Parameters:
      group - Group in the final partition
      Returns:
      The group name that contains a String representation of the group. Ex {A,D,E}
